Novik: How will you promote ETV?
Wheatley: We will promote through all groups we can, but because of the nature
of our organization we don't definitely have citizens on the Board.
Novik; You could get an advisory council of fifteen citizens. How can a
station run without people behind it to do the promotion?
Wheatleys We don't do it. Possibly this is a worn out idea. We’ll get along
with good programs first, which the people will follow without citizens in on
the planning.
Question: Is that how you get the Boston Symphony?
Wheatley: Yes.
Question: How does a community station with a responsibility beyond the
responsibility of the community do its promoting?
Wheatley: Just try to serve the whole community without distinction.
Novik: You need advertising to put any product over.
Wheatley: Promote, yes, but not by such devices as a board set up through
the heads of community groups. Do go through the organizations to create interest
but not to form a board.
